section.name: ThreeTen Extra
section.p: ThreeTen-Extra provides additional date-time classes that complement those in JDK 8.

Not every piece of date/time logic is destined for the JDK. Some concepts are too specialized or too bulky to make it in. This project provides some of those additional classes as a well-tested and reliable jar.
ThreeTen-Extra is licensed under the business-friendly BSD 3-clause license.

ul.li: Days, Months and Years amount value types
Support for the TAI and UTC time-scales

section.name: Documentation
section.p:
Various documentation is available:
The helpful user guide
The Javadoc
The change notes for the </>releases
The GitHub source repository

section.name: Releases
section.p: There are no full releases yet! Release 0.8 is the current development release intended for feedback. The code is fully tested, but there may yet be bugs and the API may yet change. There should be no great reason why it cannot be used in production if you can cope with future API change.
The project runs on JDK 8 and has no dependencies.

section.name: Support
section.p: Support on bugs, library usage or enhancement requests is available on a best efforts basis.
To suggest enhancements or contribute, please fork the source code on GitHub. Alternatively, use GitHub issues.
